{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3493886,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T18:47:25.897Z","cooked":"

We have followed the instructions on vivid hosting docs for the two radio setup. One of them is configured as the access point, with ssid suffix “AP” and with the password “password”.

The other is configured as the robot radio, with ssid suffix “robot” and with the password “password”. Both radios are on 1.2.8 version. Two radios are not able to connect to each other and link status seems to be “false”. We have chosen different channels on the access point to see if it would help both radios link, but no luck.
I’m adding a few screenshots to show you the status of both radios.

unnamed1245×125 2.33 KB

unnamed-1988×508 9.84 KB

For the robot radio:

unnamed1138×119 2.39 KB

unnamed-11437×497 15.7 KB

We are powering the access point using a 12V 2A adapter through the weidmuller connectors and have a 12V fan over the AP for cooling.

Our laptop is connected to the DS port of the AP through ethernet.

Is there something we are missing for linking two radios? Both radios have their team number set to 8159.

The suffixes of the 2 radios need to match, and then they both need to also have the same password.

Hello, thanks for the quick response. We managed to link the radios twice after setting the ssid to be the same. However, driving the robot around for 3 seconds made radios disconnect from each other both times. Connection quality was “warning” when the link was successful. Both radios are clearly visible, and in correct orientation as it has been recommended in the docs.
When I connect to the access point through 6E Wifi from my laptop, the connection quality is “excellent”, but when both radios connect to each other, it is “warning”. What could be the issue? Thanks!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T19:17:53.104Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483821,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-radio-setup-issues","display_username":"Emre Candabakoğlu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-radio-setup-issues/483821/3","custom_user_title":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493979,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T20:19:38.266Z","cooked":"

Small update:

We have been trying all the channels and all of them seems to have a very low connection quality. After two radios connecting to each other, even if i stand between where the robot is and the AP, we lose connections. I disconnected roborio from the robot radio to make sure nothing bandwith related is the issue, still no luck.

Using 2.4 Ghz mode seems to cause lots of small loss of robot comms, even when there are no signals to affect the 2.4Ghz range. That’s why we wanted to test with a 2 radio setup at this point, but it seems to perform much worse. Are we doing something wrong?? Has anyone had similar problems with the new radio?

Would you please be able to help us find what the problem is? @kiettyyyy @Thad_House @Jon_Jack

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T20:20:15.839Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":26.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483821,"topic_slug":"vh-109-2-radio-setup-issues","display_username":"Emre Candabakoğlu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-2-radio-setup-issues/483821/4","custom_user_title":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493989,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T20:25:38.075Z","cooked":"
emrecandabak:

even if i stand between where the robot is and the AP, we lose connections

The 6 GHz signal does not pass well through bodies. Make sure nobody is between the radio and the AP. And also try to place the AP up high if possible.

We tested with nothing in between two while AP was mounted high around 1.8m.
It still is the same, and when the robot moves behind the reef we lose the connection.

The AP was mounted up high, but what orientation was the radio on the robot? Pictures would be very helpful.

To echo what Thad said, placement and orientation are extremely important with 6GHz. This is why we added the ability for teams to validate RF performance at home. This way teams can see how different locations/orientations affect performance before they get a competition.

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F4239402461-files.gitbook.io%2F~%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FzaDthb1gXvbj84qIfOUE%252Fuploads%252FLGlbl6y2uWZDumFF6BEN%252FConfig-1-Iso.jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd67a81fb-4ea7-4c6a-b67a-13597bb275a3&width=400&dpr=2&quality=100&sign=548ca74b&sv=2

Mounting is the exact same as shown in this image on docs.
We had a relatively worse mounting position in 2024 champs and it did not seem to affect our performance at all. So I thought this mounting would be much better.

We tried getting the AP right in front of the robot radio to see it would be any better, but connection quality is always “warning”
